intro: Boehmeria nipononivea, commonly known as the Japanese nettle or softleaf nettle, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the Urticaceae family, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, greenish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. The fibers of its stems are used in traditional papermaking and textile production in some regions.
